intro: Prockia costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican prockia, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Costa Rica. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks and in tropical forests. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Prockia costaricensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small organisms.
